Class TitleScreenController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.TitleScreenController
public class TitleScreenController extends Object
Controller for the main Title Screen. Manages navigation to the game, settings, instructions, and game mode selection.
Author:
Abdullah Usmani

  • Constructor Details

    • TitleScreenController

      public TitleScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. Sets up the volume slider with the current sound manager volume and hides the settings panel by default.

    • handleStartGame

      public void handleStartGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Start Game" button action. Loads and displays the Game Mode selection overlay.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the start button.

    • launchGame

      public void launchGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, GameMode mode)
      Launches the game with the specific Game Mode. Loads the game layout, initializes the game controller with the selected mode, and switches the scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The event source (button click) used to find the stage.
      mode - The selected game mode (CLASSIC, DIG, or BOMB).

    • closeModeSelection

      public void closeModeSelection()
      Closes the Game Mode selection overlay. Removes the overlay from the root pane.

    • handleSettings

      public void handleSettings(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Settings" button action. Toggles the visibility of the settings panel.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the settings button.

    • handleInstructions

      public void handleInstructions(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Instructions" button action. Loads and displays the Instructions overlay.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the instructions button.

    • handleExit

      public void handleExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Exit" button action. Closes the JavaFX application and terminates the JVM.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the exit button.

    • closeInstructions

      public void closeInstructions()
      Closes the Instructions overlay. Removes the overlay from the root pane.
